page.title: 16Pigeon Palace, continued
page.content: because they provided food in the winter when fresh meat would have not ben available. Inside the dovecote there is an ingenious device for collecting the eggs and taking the doves. This consists of a stout wooden pillar in the centre of the room. A bar is fixed securely to the pillar but able to rotate around it. Suspended from the bar is a ladder with a wheel touching the ground. This ladder is able to move completely round the inside wall of the dovecote and so allow the pigeonkeeper to reach all the nest sites.
